dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, quick question: Was 2020, like, the year everyone on Wall Street got rich, even with all the absolute chaos everywhere else?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, quick question: Was twenty twenty, like, the year everyone on Wall Street got rich, even with all the absolute chaos everywhere else?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: everyone on Wall Streetfrom billionaire investors to hidebound millennial day traders in their pajamasgot rich.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, yes, exactly! It felt so messed up, but then the market just... exploded, right? After the initial shock?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, yes, exactly! It felt so messed up, but then the market just... exploded, right? After the initial shock?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Financial markets dropped like a stone early in the Covid-19 crisis and then recovered nearly 50% in a span of months, one of the fastest rebounds ever seen.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! Like, 60% recovery in months, one of the fastest ever. And who drove it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! Like, sixty percent recovery in months, one of the fastest ever. And who drove it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Financial markets dropped like a stone early in the Covid-19 crisis and then recovered nearly 50% in a span of months, one of the fastest rebounds ever seen.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, those young, quarantined day traders! The Robinhood army, outpacing the pros!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, those young, quarantined day traders! The Robinhood army, outpacing the pros!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Millions of young quarantining day traders were behind the markets rise, often beating the professionals to buy the dip.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! And the government assistance, too, allowing all that cheap corporate debt to fuel everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! And the government assistance, too, allowing all that cheap corporate debt to fuel everything.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Thanks to the governments accommodations, corporations gorged on cheap debt in 2020 to get past Covid.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh-huh, like, companies just piling on debt, making up for losses. Then IPOs everywhere, like the Dot-Com boom.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh-huh, like, companies just piling on debt, making up for losses. Then IPOs everywhere, like the Dot-Com boom.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Once markets recovered, initial public offerings began to hum like nothing seen since the Dot-Com-bubble era.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! Tesla's valuation up $650 billion! That's insane.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! Tesla's valuation up six hundred fifty dollars billion! That's insane.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Tesla gained about half a trillion dollars in value.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And SPACs, too! From, like, Wolf of Wall Street scams to actually legit now? Selling electric vehicle companies?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And SPACs, too! From, like, Wolf of Wall Street scams to actually legit now? Selling electric vehicle companies?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A market for speculative IPOs, called SPACs, took shape so bankers could list electric vehicle companies, marijuana growers and online gambling stocks, which Robinhood traders would promptly bid to the stratosphere.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! Upwards of 275 SPACs, $87 billion raised. Just wild. And smart money, obviously, thriving.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! Upwards of two hundred seventy five SPACs, eighty seven dollars billion raised. Just wild. And smart money, obviously, thriving.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Some 250 SPACs are likely to go public this year, raising over $80 billion in money.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, Baillie Gifford's Scottish Mortgage Trust? That 450% return over five years? For, like, 0.36% fee?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, Baillie Gifford's Scottish Mortgage Trust? That four hundred fifty percent return over five years? For, like, zero point three six percent fee?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: For a 0.36% fee, you get a portfolio of stocks managed by the worlds best stock-picking firm... Its investments in Tesla, Amazon, Tencent and a few dozen high-growth stocks have propelled it to a 400% gain over the past five years.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! Access to SpaceX, Stripe, ByteDance. It's incredible value.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! Access to SpaceX, Stripe, ByteDance. It's incredible value.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The trust also holds nearly 20% of its assets in private companies such as Ant Financial, SpaceX, Stripe, ByteDance, Affirm, Epic Games and TransferWise.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And Cathie Wood! She basically is the person of the year. Ark Invest, like, 160% up?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Cathie Wood! She basically is the person of the year. Ark Invest, like, one hundred sixty percent up?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Forbes Finance & Investing Person Of The Year: Cathie Wood, Founder, Ark Invest... Her flagship Ark Innovation ETF is up 150% year-to-date, and assets have surged to $15 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! Unstoppable. Her flagship fund, uh, just blew everyone away.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! Unstoppable. Her flagship fund, uh, just blew everyone away.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Her flagship Ark Innovation ETF is up 150% year-to-date, and assets have surged to $15 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, what, this Biden bull market, then? Forbes says it's coming.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, what, this Biden bull market, then? Forbes says it's coming.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Forbes Forecast: The Biden Bull Market The stars are lining up for a prolonged bull market as rock-bottom interest rates, strong household balance sheets and the eventual reopening of America give tailwinds to the economy and financial markets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! Low interest rates, strong household finances... the reopening. It's all lining up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! Low interest rates, strong household finances... the reopening. It's all lining up.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The stars are lining up for a prolonged bull market as rock-bottom interest rates, strong household balance sheets and the eventual reopening of America give tailwinds to the economy and financial markets.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Companies like Apple, Amazon, Zoom... they just keep gaining for years, apparently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Companies like Apple, Amazon, Zoom... they just keep gaining for years, apparently.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Even better, the companies that benefited from changes accelerated by the pandemic, like Apple, Zoom, Microsoft, Amazon, Prologis and Verizon, should see gains for years to come.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! It's like the new normal for growth.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! It's like the new normal for growth.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: What a year for, um, some people.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: What a year for, um, some people.
